title: MAYHEM Cancels 40th Anniversary North American Tour Due To Health Reasons
description: They promise something is being lined up for 2025.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 2 hours ago
excerpt: They promise something is being lined up for 2025.
text: Legendary Norwegian black metal unit Mayhem has sadly cancelled their 40th anniversary North American tour dates for this November due to someone in the band having a medical emergency. Mayhem is still carrying on with their European dates this December, and promise that there's something lined up for North America in 2025. "Mayhem regrets to inform fans that the upcoming 40th anniversary performances in North America are cancelled due to a member of the band having a medical emergency that requires immediate surgery, which will result in a prolonged recovery period. Tickets will be refunded at point of purchase. "Fret not, American and Canadian legion, as Mayhem will have something coming up next year that will make this up to those of you who have been disappointed by this news." As it stands right now, Mayhem's 40th anniversary tour dates for 2024 and 2025 are as follows. 12/4 Paris (FR) @ Bataclan12/5 Oberhausen (DE) @ Turbinenhalle 112/6 Frankfurt (DE) @ Zoom12/7 Regensburg (DE) @ Airport Eventhall12/8 Vienna (AT) @ Simm CIty12/10 Pratteln (CH) @ Z-712/11 Milan (IT) @ Live Club12/13 Copenhagen (DK) @ Amager Bio12/15 Stockholm (SE) @ Fållan1/9 Brisbane @ Princess Theatre1/10 Sydney @ Metro Theatre1/12 Melbourne @ Northcote Theatre Want More Metal? Legendary Norwegian black metal unit Mayhem has sadly cancelled their 40th anniversary North American tour dates for this November due to someone in the band having a medical emergency. Mayhem is still carrying on with their European dates this December, and promise that there's something lined up for North America in 2025.

"Mayhem regrets to inform fans that the upcoming 40th anniversary performances in North America are cancelled due to a member of the band having a medical emergency that requires immediate surgery, which will result in a prolonged recovery period. Tickets will be refunded at point of purchase.

"Fret not, American and Canadian legion, as Mayhem will have something coming up next year that will make this up to those of you who have been disappointed by this news."
